project.name: Chicken Coop Tycoon - Store UI Redesign
project.description: Complete visual redesign of the Store UI to create a more engaging, immersive 'Supply Shack' themed experience with modern simulator-style aesthetics, improved item cards, and enhanced visual hierarchy.
project.thematicConcept: The Supply Shack - Transform the UI frame into a physical object that feels like a wooden shack or storefront in the game world.

mcpInstructions.description: Use the Roblox Studio MCP server to interact with Roblox Studio directly for testing and verification.

availableTools.name: run_code
availableTools.description: Execute Luau code directly in Roblox Studio. Use this to test UI elements, check styling, and verify visual changes.
examples: Check frame properties: local store = game.Players.LocalPlayer.PlayerGui.StoreUI; print(store.MainFrame.BackgroundColor3)

availableTools.name: insert_model
availableTools.description: Insert a model from the Roblox marketplace into the workspace for texture or asset references.

workflow: 1. Before making changes, use run_code to understand current UI structure
2. After implementing visual changes, verify in Studio that colors, gradients, and layouts render correctly
3. Test on different screen sizes to ensure responsive design
4. Use insert_model if placeholder assets are needed for wood textures or icons
requirements: Roblox Studio must be running with the MCP plugin installed
The place file (build.rbxl) should be open in Studio
Test in both Edit mode and Play mode to verify runtime appearance

Uncommon.description: Light Green to Dark Green gradient

Rare.description: Light Blue to Dark Blue gradient

Epic.description: Light Purple to Dark Purple gradient

Legendary.description: Light Orange to Dark Orange gradient

workItems.title: Redesign Main Frame as 'The Supply Shack'
workItems.description: Transform the dark grey store window into an immersive wooden shack-themed container with warm colors, rounded corners, and a thick brown border to simulate wooden planks.
steps: Locate mainFrame creation in StoreUI.lua (around line 1000-1050)
Change BackgroundColor3 from dark grey to warm off-white RGB(255, 248, 220)
Add UICorner with CornerRadius of UDim.new(0, 20) for bubbly feel
Add UIStroke with Color RGB(101, 67, 33), Thickness 4 for wood border effect
Optionally add UIGradient for subtle wood grain effect (vertical, light to slightly darker)
acceptanceCriteria: Main frame has warm cream/off-white background
Corners are rounded (20px radius)
Thick dark brown border creates wooden frame appearance
Overall appearance matches 'wooden shack' theme
workItems.technicalNotes: The wood texture can be achieved through color alone initially. Later iteration could add an ImageLabel background with actual wood texture asset.

workItems.title: Create Wooden Sign Header
workItems.description: Replace the plain text header with a wooden sign that appears to hang from the top of the frame. Rename 'STORE' to 'The Roost' or 'Egg Shop' for immersion.
steps: Create a new headerSign Frame above or integrated with main frame
Set headerSign BackgroundColor3 to RGB(139, 90, 43) medium brown
Add UICorner with radius 8-10px for wood plank look
Add UIStroke with darker brown for sign border
Create title TextLabel with text 'The Roost' or 'Egg Shop'
Use Enum.Font.FredokaOne or Enum.Font.LuckiestGuy for cartoony feel
Add TextStroke effect (TextStrokeColor3 dark brown, TextStrokeTransparency 0)
Move restock timer below header with UIGradient (Red to Orange) for urgency
acceptanceCriteria: Header appears as a hanging wooden sign
Title text is bold, cartoony, and readable
Text has visible stroke/outline for pop effect
Restock timer is styled with urgency gradient
workItems.technicalNotes: Consider adding small 'nail' or 'rope' decorative elements later to enhance the hanging sign effect.

workItems.title: Redesign Close Button as Wooden 'X'
workItems.description: Transform the close button into a red wooden square with a white painted 'X' that matches the rustic theme.
steps: Locate closeButton creation in StoreUI.lua
Change BackgroundColor3 to RGB(180, 50, 50) red wood color
Add UICorner with small radius (4-6px) for slight rounding
Add UIStroke with darker red RGB(120, 30, 30) for depth
Set Text to 'X' with white color and text stroke
Use Enum.Font.GothamBold or Enum.Font.FredokaOne for the X
Add hover effect: slightly brighter red on MouseEnter
acceptanceCriteria: Close button appears as red wooden square
White X is clearly visible with stroke
Button has subtle depth from border
Hover state provides visual feedback
workItems.technicalNotes: Hover effect can be implemented with MouseEnter/MouseLeave events adjusting BackgroundColor3.

workItems.title: Redesign Tabs as Hanging Tags
workItems.description: Transform the navigation tabs from grey boxes inside the window to hanging folder tabs or tags that sit on top of the main window, with the active tab appearing connected to the content area.
steps: Locate tabFrame and tab button creation in StoreUI.lua
Reposition tabs to sit above/overlapping the top edge of the scroll content
Create tab buttons as folder-tab shapes using Frame + UICorner (round top corners only)
Active tab: BackgroundColor3 RGB(255, 220, 150) bright tan, larger size, connected to window
Inactive tabs: BackgroundColor3 RGB(180, 140, 90) muted brown, slightly smaller
Add drop shadows to icons using duplicate offset labels or ImageLabel shadows
Apply slight rotation (Rotation = 2 to -2) to icons for dynamic feel
Ensure tab icons remain visible and add tooltips on hover
acceptanceCriteria: Tabs appear as folder tabs sitting on top of content
Active tab is visually larger and brighter
Active tab appears connected to main content area
Icons have drop shadows and slight tilt
Tab transitions are smooth when switching
workItems.technicalNotes: Use ZIndex to layer tabs above the main frame edge. The connected appearance can be achieved by matching the bottom of active tab color to the scroll frame background.

workItems.title: Increase Item Card Height and Add Padding
workItems.description: Increase the vertical height of each item card by 30% to give content room to breathe, and add proper padding inside the scrolling frame.
steps: Locate createItemCard function in StoreUI.lua (around line 90)
Change card Size from UDim2.new(1, -10, 0, 80) to UDim2.new(1, -20, 0, 104)
Update Position calculations to use new height (104 + 8 spacing = 112 per item)
Add UIPadding to scrollFrame with PaddingLeft/Right/Top/Bottom of 10px
Update UIListLayout (if used) or manual positioning to account for new sizes
Verify ScrollingFrame CanvasSize updates correctly for new heights
acceptanceCriteria: Item cards are 30% taller than before
Cards have breathing room and don't touch frame edges
Scrolling works correctly with new sizes
All items remain accessible via scrolling
workItems.technicalNotes: Current card height is 80px. New height should be 104px (80 * 1.3). Spacing between cards should be 8px.

workItems.title: Apply Rarity-Based Gradient Backgrounds
workItems.description: Replace flat dark grey card backgrounds with gradient backgrounds that correspond to item rarity, making each tier visually distinct and appealing.
steps: Create RARITY_GRADIENTS table with start/end colors for each rarity tier
In createItemCard, add UIGradient child to the card Frame
Set UIGradient Color to ColorSequence from rarity start to end color
Set UIGradient Rotation to 90 (vertical gradient, light on top)
Remove or repurpose the existing rarity bar (now redundant)
Ensure text remains readable on all gradient backgrounds
Add subtle UIStroke to card for definition (dark color, thickness 2)
acceptanceCriteria: Common items: Grey to White gradient background
Uncommon items: Light Green to Dark Green gradient
Rare items: Light Blue to Dark Blue gradient
Epic items: Light Purple to Dark Purple gradient
Legendary items: Light Orange to Dark Orange gradient
Mythic items: Pink to Deep Pink gradient
All text remains readable on gradient backgrounds
workItems.technicalNotes: ColorSequence requires ColorSequenceKeypoints. Example: ColorSequence.new({ColorSequenceKeypoint.new(0, startColor), ColorSequenceKeypoint.new(1, endColor)})

workItems.title: Enlarge Item Icons with Pop-Out Effect
workItems.description: Make the egg/item icons 2x larger and position them to slightly overlap the card boundaries, creating a 3D pop-out effect that draws attention.
steps: Locate iconLabel creation in createItemCard (around line 138)
Increase icon Size from UDim2.new(0, 30, 0, 30) to UDim2.new(0, 60, 0, 60)
Adjust Position to overlap left edge: UDim2.new(0, -10, 0.5, -30)
Set iconLabel.ZIndex higher than card to appear above edge
Consider using ImageLabel instead of emoji for better visual quality
Add subtle drop shadow behind icon (duplicate with offset and transparency)
Increase TextSize from 24 to 48 for emoji icons
acceptanceCriteria: Item icons are twice as large (60x60 vs 30x30)
Icons overlap the left edge of the card by ~10px
Icons appear to 'pop out' from the card
Drop shadow adds depth to the icon
Icon scaling doesn't break card layout
workItems.technicalNotes: For a true 3D effect, consider using ViewportFrame with a 3D egg model that can rotate. This is a stretch goal for later iteration.

workItems.title: Update Typography to Cartoony Fonts
workItems.description: Replace the current Gotham fonts with chunky, cartoony fonts like Fredoka One or Luckiest Guy for headers and item names to match the playful theme.
steps: Update item name TextLabels to use Enum.Font.FredokaOne
Add TextStroke to item names (TextStrokeColor3 = black, TextStrokeTransparency = 0.3)
Keep description/rarity text in Enum.Font.GothamMedium for readability
Update header/title fonts to Enum.Font.FredokaOne
Ensure all text remains readable with new fonts
Make item names white with dark stroke for visibility on gradients
acceptanceCriteria: Item names use chunky, cartoony font (FredokaOne)
Item names have visible text stroke outline
Body text remains readable with standard font
Overall typography feels playful and cohesive
workItems.technicalNotes: FredokaOne is available in Roblox Studio. If not rendering well, LuckiestGuy is an alternative. Test font availability in Studio.

workItems.title: Add Subtext Description to Item Cards
workItems.description: Add italicized subtext below the item name that describes what the egg contains, e.g., 'Contains basic chickens' for Common Eggs.
steps: Add parameter for description/subtext to createItemCard function
Create subtextLabel TextLabel below the name label
Set Font to Enum.Font.GothamMedium with smaller TextSize
Use italics-style by slightly reducing opacity or using different color
Position subtext at UDim2.new(0, 70, 0, 35) below name
For eggs, show 'Contains [rarity] chickens' based on hatch possibilities
Ensure subtext doesn't overlap with other elements
acceptanceCriteria: Each item card shows descriptive subtext
Subtext is visually subordinate to main item name
Subtext provides useful information about item contents
Layout accommodates subtext without crowding
workItems.technicalNotes: Pull description from EggConfig or ChickenConfig. May need to add description field to configs if not present.

workItems.title: Enhance Purchase Buttons with Visual Hierarchy
workItems.description: Improve the buy buttons by adding currency icons inside the buttons, applying UIStroke to premium currency buttons, and creating a stacked vertical layout.
steps: Redesign button layout: Stack buttons vertically on right side of card
Cash button: Green background with money bag emoji + price (ðŸ’µ $100)
Premium button: Blue background with gem emoji + price (ðŸ’Ž 5), add UIStroke for 'juicy' look
Add UIStroke to premium button (white or light blue, thickness 2) for emphasis
Add subtle shine effect using UIGradient (white to transparent, rotation 45)
Position buttons: UDim2.new(1, -90, 0, 10) and UDim2.new(1, -90, 0, 50)
Ensure icons and prices are within button bounds
Add hover effects: brightness increase on MouseEnter
acceptanceCriteria: Buttons are stacked vertically on the right
Each button shows currency icon + price
Premium currency button has visible stroke/glow effect
Buttons have hover state feedback
Visual hierarchy makes premium option stand out
workItems.technicalNotes: The shine effect uses UIGradient with Transparency set to NumberSequence from 0.8 to 1 with white color.

workItems.title: Transform Replenish Button to Gold 'Restock Now' Button
workItems.description: Make the replenish/restock button more attractive with gold coloring, emoji, and white text stroke to attract clicks and encourage spending.
steps: Locate replenishButton creation in StoreUI.lua
Change BackgroundColor3 to gold RGB(255, 215, 0)
Update Text to 'âš¡ Restock Now!'
Set TextColor3 to dark brown or black for contrast
Add TextStroke (white, transparency 0.2) for pop effect
Add UIStroke to button (dark gold/orange) for definition
Add UIGradient for metallic shine (light gold to gold)
Add hover effect: brighter gold on MouseEnter
Consider adding subtle pulsing animation to draw attention
acceptanceCriteria: Replenish button is gold colored
Button text includes lightning emoji
Button has visible shine/metallic effect
Text is readable with stroke effect
Button attracts attention appropriately
codeLocations: src/client/StoreUI.lua (replenish button creation and footer area)
workItems.technicalNotes: For pulsing animation, use TweenService to animate Size or BackgroundColor3 slightly in a loop.

workItems.title: Add Padding and Spacing to Scroll Content
workItems.description: Add UIPadding inside the scrolling frame so items don't touch the edges, and ensure consistent spacing between items.
steps: Locate scrollFrame creation in StoreUI.lua
Add UIPadding with PaddingLeft, PaddingRight, PaddingTop, PaddingBottom = UDim.new(0, 10)
Add UIListLayout with Padding = UDim.new(0, 8) for consistent spacing
Remove manual Position calculations from createItemCard
Let UIListLayout handle positioning
Update CanvasSize calculation to account for padding and spacing
Set ScrollBarThickness to 6 for thinner, cleaner scrollbar
Style scrollbar with matching theme colors if possible
acceptanceCriteria: 10px padding on all sides of scroll content
8px consistent spacing between item cards
Items don't touch scroll frame edges
Scrolling is smooth and responsive
Scrollbar is visible but not obtrusive
workItems.technicalNotes: When using UIListLayout, set SortOrder to Enum.SortOrder.LayoutOrder and assign LayoutOrder to each card.

workItems.title: Apply Theme to All Store Tabs
workItems.description: Ensure the new visual theme is consistently applied across all store tabs (eggs, chickens, supplies, powerups, weapons) not just the eggs tab.
steps: Review createPowerUpCard function and apply matching theme
Review trap card creation (if separate) and apply theme
Review weapon card creation (if separate) and apply theme
Ensure all cards use rarity gradients where applicable
Apply consistent typography across all tabs
Ensure all buy buttons follow new design
Test each tab for visual consistency
acceptanceCriteria: All tabs use the same visual language
Gradient backgrounds applied where rarity exists
Fonts are consistent across tabs
Buttons follow same design pattern
No visual inconsistencies between tabs
workItems.technicalNotes: May need to refactor card creation into shared helper functions to reduce code duplication.

workItems.title: Add Opening/Closing Animations
workItems.description: Add smooth animations when opening and closing the store to make the UI feel more polished and alive.
steps: Import TweenService at top of StoreUI.lua
Create open animation: Scale from 0 to 1, or slide from bottom
Create close animation: Scale from 1 to 0, or slide to bottom
Apply easing style: Enum.EasingStyle.Back for bouncy feel
Duration: 0.3-0.4 seconds for snappy feel
Ensure isOpen flag is set correctly during animations
Prevent interaction during animation if needed
acceptanceCriteria: Store opens with smooth animation
Store closes with smooth animation
Animations feel snappy and polished
No flickering or visual artifacts during animation
workItems.technicalNotes: Use TweenInfo.new(0.35, Enum.EasingStyle.Back, Enum.EasingDirection.Out) for opening, In for closing.

workItems.title: Add Tab Switching Animation
workItems.description: Animate the transition between tabs to make the store feel more dynamic and responsive.
steps: When switching tabs, fade out current content (Transparency tween)
Slide in new content from the side or fade in
Animate active tab growing and inactive tab shrinking
Use TweenService for smooth transitions
Duration: 0.2 seconds for responsive feel
Ensure content is ready before animation completes
acceptanceCriteria: Switching tabs has visible animation
Active tab visually expands/highlights
Content transitions smoothly
Animation doesn't feel slow or laggy
workItems.technicalNotes: Consider using CanvasGroup for efficient opacity tweening if fading multiple elements.

workItems.title: [Stretch] Add 3D Rotating Eggs with ViewportFrame
workItems.description: Replace 2D egg icons with 3D egg models in ViewportFrames that slowly rotate, providing a premium feel to the store.
steps: Create or obtain 3D egg models for each rarity tier
Create ViewportFrame in place of iconLabel
Add WorldModel to ViewportFrame
Clone egg model into WorldModel
Set up Camera for ViewportFrame
Create rotation animation using RunService.RenderStepped
Apply appropriate lighting to ViewportFrame
Fallback to emoji for performance-constrained devices
acceptanceCriteria: 3D eggs display in store cards
Eggs rotate smoothly
Colors match rarity tiers
Performance remains acceptable
workItems.technicalNotes: This is a stretch goal. ViewportFrames can impact performance, so implement with option to disable. May require creating egg mesh assets.

implementationOrder: Phase 1 - Foundation: Items 1, 5, 12 (Main frame, card sizing, padding)
Phase 2 - Theme: Items 2, 3, 4 (Header, close button, tabs)
Phase 3 - Cards: Items 6, 7, 8, 9 (Gradients, icons, typography, subtext)
Phase 4 - Buttons: Items 10, 11 (Purchase buttons, replenish button)
Phase 5 - Consistency: Item 13 (Apply to all tabs)
testingChecklist: Verify store opens and closes correctly
Test all tabs are accessible and styled consistently
Verify gradient backgrounds render on all rarity tiers
Test purchase functionality still works for all item types
Verify restock timer displays and updates correctly
Test on different screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop)
Verify text is readable on all gradient backgrounds
Test hover states on all interactive elements
Verify animations don't cause performance issues
Test with various player money amounts for button states
